document_title: Meningococcal meningitis: Signs, causes, diagnosis, treatment
subsection_content:
Meningococcal meningitis is a dangerous disease with a high mortality rate. Children who have been treated for the disease can still face long-term sequelae caused by the disease. Therefore, proactively preventing diseases in children is extremely important. The most effective way to prevent disease in children is to vaccinate against meningococcal disease.
Currently, in our country, vaccination against meningococcal meningitis has been widely deployed with 3 common types A, B and C. After being vaccinated, children will have immunity to with all three bacterial serotypes. Meningococcal BC vaccination will be given when the child is 6 months old or older and the AC shot will be given when the child is 2 years old or older. After that, the child will receive additional booster shots according to the doctor's instructions.
Vaccination is the most effective way to prevent meningococcal disease
There are currently 2 types of vaccines to prevent meningococcal meningitis types B, C and types A, C, Y, W. The vaccine is widely used in Vietnam, bringing high disease prevention effectiveness, minimizing disease risk. high risk of disease and complications of meningitis.
VA-Mengoc-BC (CuBa) Menactra (USA) Subject Indications for vaccination in children 6 months and older Indications for vaccination in children 9 months and older Vaccination schedule 2 injections 45 days apart Children from 9 months to under 24 months: 2 doses at least 3 months apart Children 2 years and older: 1 single dose
In addition, mothers should avoid letting their children come into contact with sick people if they have not been vaccinated to prevent the disease. In case the child has come into contact with an infected person, the mother needs to notify the doctor and immediately carry out preventive treatment according to the doctor's instructions for the child. In fact, children are still at risk of contracting meningococcal disease even after being fully vaccinated due to a weak immune system. In this case, the disease often occurs at a milder level and has fewer complications. .
At the same time, mothers should pay attention to keeping the house and children's play area clean, ensuring hygiene, light and ventilation. If the child is living in an area with a disease outbreak, mothers should pay attention to monitoring the child's symptoms to detect the disease and promptly treat the disease, especially when the child begins to show signs of pharyngitis and fever.
For more information about meningococcal meningitis and other health problems for children, parents can contact the Department of Pediatrics - Tam Anh General Hospital System at the address:
Through the above sharing, we hope parents have a better understanding of the danger of meningococcal disease in children. Full vaccination as recommended by the Ministry of Health is extremely important in supporting resistance, strengthening the immune system and protecting children's health. Not only that, children are susceptible to diseases, so when children show signs of illness, take them to the hospital for early examination and treatment.
